data.title: Cryptography's Role in Data Security Discussed by Experts
data.description:
According to Foresight News, Professor Ian Miers, an expert in security and applied cryptography, recently shared insights on Twitter regarding the role of cryptography in data security. Miers emphasized that cryptography is a subset of the security field rather than a theoretical branch. He cautioned against the centralized storage of highly sensitive data, even when using advanced cryptographic techniques like MPC (Multi-Party Computation) or FHE (Fully Homomorphic Encryption), citing examples such as global AML (Anti-Money Laundering) KYC (Know Your Customer) processes or content moderation strategies.

Vitalik Buterin, a prominent figure in the cryptocurrency community, responded to Miers' comments by highlighting that content itself is often in plaintext. He suggested that anonymous posting combined with blocking features could be achieved through ZK (Zero-Knowledge) proofs, and AI-driven content moderation could utilize ZK proof algorithms with delayed publication.

In the context of encrypted message content moderation, such as chat control, Miers pointed out that neither TEE (Trusted Execution Environment) nor cryptography can securely handle servers viewing all messages. Buterin agreed with this assessment and proposed that client-side scanning could be a compliant method. He suggested that users could opt for local AI maintained by different organizations or choose to disable it entirely, eliminating the need for complex cryptographic solutions.

data.title: Ethereum Sets December Date for Game-Changing Fusaka Upgrade
data.description:
Ethereum will activate its Fusaka upgrade on December 3, adding PeerDAS, higher gas limits, and doubled blob capacity to boost scalability and efficiency.

The post Ethereum Sets December Date for Game-Changing Fusaka Upgrade first appeared on Ecoinimist.

source: https://ecoinimist.com/2025/10/31/ethereum-sets-december-fusaka-launch/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=ethereum-sets-december-fusaka-launch

data.title: Bitcoin Whale Deposits Significant Amount to Centralized Exchange
data.description: According to BlockBeats On-chain Detection, a prominent Bitcoin whale has deposited 200 Bitcoins, valued at approximately $21.94 million, into a centralized exchange. Over the past three weeks, this whale has transferred a total of 6,003 Bitcoins to the platform, amounting to roughly $672 million.

data.title: Saylor says Strategy unlikely to scoop up rivals, ‘just a lot of uncertainty’
data.description:
Strategy is unlikely to make deals to acquire its Bitcoin-buying rivals, with founder Michael Saylor saying it’s too risky.
source: https://cointelegraph.com/news/michael-saylor-strategy-unlikely-acquire-rivals?utm_source=rss_feed&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=rss_partner_inbound

data.title: Core Scientific Shareholders Block $9B AI Merger with CoreWeave
data.description:
Core Scientific shareholders have voted down a proposed $9 billion merger with AI firm CoreWeave, ending one of the crypto industry’s most ambitious AI tie-ups.

The post Core Scientific Shareholders Block $9B AI Merger with CoreWeave first appeared on Ecoinimist.

source: https://ecoinimist.com/2025/10/31/core-scientific-sharesholders-ai-merge/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=core-scientific-sharesholders-ai-merge

data.title: Analysts: Strategy tested nine new addresses, suspected to be related to a change in hosting provider.
data.description: Analyst Emmett Gallic noted that Strategy tested nine new addresses (excluding change addresses), which appears to be related to a change in custodian. ScriptHash addresses (starting with 3) are the same type as Coinbase Prime deposit addresses, but funds were not aggregated in this test, hence this discrepancy.

data.title: The Ether.Fi community has proposed allocating up to $50 million of its treasury funds for token buybacks.
data.description: The Ether.Fi community has proposed allocating treasury funds for an ETHFI buyback program, authorizing the foundation to use treasury funds to buy back ETHFI tokens when the market price falls below $3, with a maximum buyback amount of $50 million. The goal is to continuously accumulate ETHFI while the price remains below this threshold and increase the proportion of protocol revenue used for buybacks. The buyback will begin immediately upon DAO approval and continue until one of the following occurs: the maximum amount is reached; the foundation deems the program complete; or a subsequent governance vote modifies or terminates the program. The next step will be a four-day vote on Snapshot. Once approved, the buyback program will take effect immediately upon meeting certain price conditions.

data.title: Buidlpad launches new platform Vibe, focusing on early-stage project financing.
data.description: Community crowdfunding platform Buidlpad has launched a new platform, Vibe. This platform will focus on providing a channel for high-quality projects with smaller funding needs and earlier funding stages. Vibe will maintain Buidlpad's same vetting standards, including KYC and anti-Syllabic mechanisms, to protect genuine users.

data.title: Historical data: Bitcoin's average monthly return in November was 46.02%, while Ethereum's was 7.88%.
data.description: According to Coinglass data, Bitcoin's average November return since 2013 is +46.02%, the highest average monthly return on record. There were four years with negative November returns: 2018, 2019, 2021, and 2022. Similarly, Ethereum's average November return since 2016 is +7.88%, also with four years of negative November returns: 2016, 2018, 2019, and 2022.

data.title: Hong Kong Appoints Chair and Members for Stablecoin Review Tribunal
data.description: According to Odaily, the Chief Executive of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region has appointed the chair and members of the Stablecoin Review Tribunal under the Stablecoin Ordinance (Chapter 656). Senior barrister Lan De Ye will serve as the chair, with panel members including Professor Huang Hao, Qiu Yuan Yun, Lu Zhi Hong, Mai Ye Cheng, Wu Jian Lin, and Xiao Zi Qian. The tribunal, established under the Stablecoin Ordinance, is tasked with reviewing specified decisions made by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority upon receiving appeals. This initiative aims to ensure that regulatory decisions are reasonable and fair.

data.title: Yi Lihua: I started buying ETH when it dropped to $1800 and sold it all around $4500.
data.description: Liquid Capital founder Yi Lihua posted on the X platform: "Many people ask why our bottom-fishing and top-selling strategies are relatively accurate. The truth is, it's not as rosy as it seems. When ETH fell to $1800, we started buying. We panicked when it dropped to $1350. Later, we started calling for buying when it rebounded to $1450 and issued research reports at $1750. When it reached $2700, the Middle East black swan event caused a pullback to $2100, which led to us being ridiculed online as 'E Lihua.' Then, we prematurely unleveraged at over $3000 and liquidated our positions around $4500 instead of $4900. No one is 100% correct, but in the right trend, fatal mistakes are less likely. Buying is for selling, and selling is for buying."

data.title: This week's top mining news highlights: Riot reports $104.5 million net profit in the third quarter.
data.description: Week 43 of 2025 (October 24 - October 30): 1. (CANG), a Bitcoin mining company listed on the New York Stock Exchange.

data.title: Bitcoin Spot ETFs Experience Significant Outflows
data.description:
According to PANews, data from SoSoValue indicates that on October 30, Bitcoin spot ETFs saw a total net outflow of $488 million. The largest single-day net outflow was recorded by BlackRock's ETF IBIT, which experienced a withdrawal of $291 million. Despite this, IBIT's historical total net inflow stands at $65.052 billion.

Following IBIT, the ETF ARKB, managed by Ark Invest and 21Shares, reported a net outflow of $65.6193 million. The historical total net inflow for ARKB is currently $2.053 billion.

As of the latest report, the total net asset value of Bitcoin spot ETFs is $143.944 billion, with an ETF net asset ratio of 6.71% relative to Bitcoin's total market capitalization. The cumulative historical net inflow for these ETFs has reached $61.378 billion.

data.title: Bitcoin spot ETFs saw a total net outflow of $488 million yesterday, with none of the twelve ETFs experiencing net inflows.
data.description: According to SoSoValue data, Bitcoin spot ETFs saw a total net outflow of $488 million yesterday (October 30th, Eastern Time). The BlackRock ETF IBIT experienced the largest single-day net outflow, at $291 million, bringing its historical total net inflow to $65.052 billion. Following closely was the Ark Invest and 21Shares ETF ARKB, with a single-day net outflow of $65.6193 million, bringing its historical total net inflow to $2.053 billion. As of this writing, the total net asset value of Bitcoin spot ETFs is $143.944 billion, with an ETF net asset value ratio (market capitalization as a percentage of total Bitcoin market capitalization) of 6.71%, and a historical cumulative net inflow of $61.378 billion.

data.title: A New York court extended an asset freeze order to assist with the liquidation of Multichain in Singapore.
data.description: On Thursday, a New York judge temporarily extended a freeze order on wallets holding approximately $63 million worth of stolen USDC stablecoins, supporting a request from the liquidators of the defunct cryptocurrency cross-chain bridge Multichain in Singapore. Judge David S. Jones ordered Circle to keep three Ethereum wallets frozen and to retain the dollar reserves backing the stolen USDC. The liquidators warned that lifting the freeze order in the state court would cause “irreparable harm.” The order also suspended another class-action lawsuit filed by a group of U.S. investors attempting to gain control of the funds. The case was transferred to the Southern District of New York federal court last Friday after Circle invoked the Fair Class Action Act. Under Section 1519 of the U.S. Bankruptcy Code, the order is temporary, and the court will review whether the Singapore liquidation proceedings meet the criteria for “foreign principal proceedings” to regulate cross-border bankruptcy cooperation. (Decrypt)

data.title: Potential December Rate Hike by Bank of Japan Analyzed
data.description:
According to BlockBeats, DBS Bank analyst Ma Tieying has commented on the possibility of the Bank of Japan raising its policy rate by 25 basis points in December.

The senior economist anticipates that Japanese labor unions will set their wage negotiation targets for 2026 around November to December. She noted that the Japanese Trade Union Confederation has already indicated a wage growth target of 5% for 2026, consistent with this year's target.

Furthermore, the economist mentioned that if the Federal Reserve delays its rate cut during the December meeting, the likelihood of a rate hike by the Bank of Japan in December could increase, providing a window of opportunity for action.
